definition: lit. one hundred shots, one hundred hits/to carry out a task with great precision/to shoot with unfailing accuracy/be a crack shot (idiom)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Be more careful not to miss once than to hit a hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 多加小心，避免萬一失手勝過百發百中。

sentences.english: The divination of despair is a sort of mysterious bow which never misses its aim.
sentences.chinese: 失望中的猜測是一種百發百中的神矢。

sentences.english: And artillery-men, the deadliest that ever fired gun.
sentences.chinese: 還有炮手，那些百發百中的神槍手。

definition: see 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]
(coll.) lowest-ranking (student, participant etc)/to rank at the bottom of the list/to finish last
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
